page.title: 06BIRKDALE LIBRARY
page.content: Birkdale library is situated in Liverpool Road.It was opened in 1974. Previously,it was situated in Weld Parade,next to the Town Hall.Andrew Carnegie paid for the first Birkdale library as well as others.The government has paid for this recent one.The library employs three full-time and three part-time staff It is open for six days a week at various times.Its total stock consists of about three thousand books.These books cover a wide variety of subjects.It caters for most people and subjects.As well as the general library,it has a reference and children's library.It is used by several local groups in the evenings for meetings. it shows local artists pictures.It serves thousands of people in various ways and with it's friendly service.
